question: How many students may be on a team?
answer: Teams must consist of 5-6 members. Teams with less or more students will not be accepted.

question: Can I participate in SMT remotely?
answer: Yes, see the SMT Online Page.

question: Do students on the same team have to be from the same school or established mathematical organization?
answer: Yes, students must be from the same school or mathematical organization. If a student's school is participating, however, that student must participate through their school.

question: What schools or organizations can participate in SMT?
answer: SMT 2025 will be open to all domestic students from US-based schools or organizations.

question: Can international teams participate in SMT? If so, how do they register?
answer: Yes, but they must participate in SMT Online - see that page for more details.

question: Are calculators allowed?
answer: No. Calculators are not allowed on any portion of the tests. Check the SMT rules for information on permitted items.

question: What topics may appear on the tests? How hard are the tests?
answer: See the mathematical expectations document for guidelines on what topics may appear on each test. It is also advisable to look at the test from previous years in order to get a sense of the typical style and difficulty of SMT tests.

question: Which individual test should I take?
answer: If you have little or no experience with contest math, we strongly recommend you take the General Test. Looking at past tests will help you get a sense of the difficulty of each test.

question: Do we need to have a teacher or coach attend SMT in person?
answer: Yes, you must have at least one authorized adult chaperone present per team who is responsible for the team during the tournament.

question: Can I use the problems from previous SMT tests listed below in my classroom/book/etc?
answer: Yes! Feel free to use any officially released problems, provided you cite us in the format 'Stanford Math Tournament [Year] [Round] [Problem #]'

question: What accommodations will SMT 2025 be providing for students who observe Passover?
answer: The tournament is planned so that the main competition events will finish by 4:30, and awards will finish by 6:30, well before sunset. We will also provide chametz-free lunches for any students who require them. Please reach out to us with any other questions!
